briefdescription.para: Internal struct representing a message filter function.
Function to be called in protected_change_watch() with refcount held.
Function to be called in protected_change_watch() with refcount held.

memberdef.definition: typedef void(* DBusWatchToggleFunction)(DBusWatchList *list, DBusWatch *watch, dbus_bool_t enabled)
memberdef.name: DBusWatchToggleFunction

briefdescription.para: Function to be called in protected_change_watch() with refcount held.
Function to be called in protected_change_timeout() with refcount held.
Function to be called in protected_change_timeout() with refcount held.
Function to be called in protected_change_timeout() with refcount held.
Acquire the dispatcher.

detaileddescription.para: This is a separate lock so the main connection lock can be dropped to call out to application dispatch handlers.

briefdescription.para: Release the dispatcher when you're done with it.

detaileddescription.para: Only call after you've acquired the dispatcher. Wakes up at most one thread currently waiting to acquire the dispatcher.

briefdescription.para: Blocks until the outgoing message queue is empty.

detaileddescription.para: Assumes connection lock already held.
If you call this, you MUST call update_dispatch_status afterword...

briefdescription.para: Acquires the connection lock.
Releases the connection lock.
Wakes up the main loop if it is sleeping Needed if we're e.g.

detaileddescription.para: queueing outgoing messages on a thread while the mainloop sleeps.

briefdescription.para: Adds a message-containing list link to the incoming message queue, taking ownership of the link and the message's current refcount.

detaileddescription.para: Cannot fail due to lack of memory.

briefdescription.para: Adds a link + message to the incoming message queue.

detaileddescription.para: Can't fail. Takes ownership of both link and message.

parameterdescription.para: the list node and message to queue.

briefdescription.para: Checks whether there are messages in the outgoing message queue.

detaileddescription.para: Called with connection lock held.

simplesect.para: TRUE if the outgoing queue is non-empty.

briefdescription.para: Checks whether there are messages in the outgoing message queue.

detaileddescription.para: Use dbus_connection_flush() to block until all outgoing messages have been written to the underlying transport (such as a socket).

simplesect.para: TRUE if the outgoing queue is non-empty.

briefdescription.para: Gets the next outgoing message.

detaileddescription.para: The message remains in the queue, and the caller does not own a reference to it.

briefdescription.para: Notifies the connection that a message has been sent, so the message can be removed from the outgoing queue.

detaileddescription.para: Called with the connection lock held.

memberdef.argsstring: (DBusConnection *connection, DBusWatch *watch, DBusWatchAddFunction add_function, DBusWatchRemoveFunction remove_function, DBusWatchToggleFunction toggle_function, dbus_bool_t enabled)
memberdef.name: protected_change_watch

briefdescription.para: Adds a watch using the connection's DBusAddWatchFunction if available.

detaileddescription.para: Otherwise records the watch to be added when said function is available. Also re-adds the watch if the DBusAddWatchFunction changes. May fail due to lack of memory. Connection lock should be held when calling this.

briefdescription.para: Removes a watch using the connection's DBusRemoveWatchFunction if available.

detaileddescription.para: It's an error to call this function on a watch that was not previously added. Connection lock should be held when calling this.

briefdescription.para: Toggles a watch and notifies app via connection's DBusWatchToggledFunction if available.

detaileddescription.para: It's an error to call this function on a watch that was not previously added. Connection lock should be held when calling this.

memberdef.argsstring: (DBusConnection *connection, DBusTimeout *timeout, DBusTimeoutAddFunction add_function, DBusTimeoutRemoveFunction remove_function, DBusTimeoutToggleFunction toggle_function, dbus_bool_t enabled)
memberdef.name: protected_change_timeout

briefdescription.para: Adds a timeout using the connection's DBusAddTimeoutFunction if available.

detaileddescription.para: Otherwise records the timeout to be added when said function is available. Also re-adds the timeout if the DBusAddTimeoutFunction changes. May fail due to lack of memory. The timeout will fire repeatedly until removed. Connection lock should be held when calling this.

briefdescription.para: Removes a timeout using the connection's DBusRemoveTimeoutFunction if available.

detaileddescription.para: It's an error to call this function on a timeout that was not previously added. Connection lock should be held when calling this.

briefdescription.para: Toggles a timeout and notifies app via connection's DBusTimeoutToggledFunction if available.

detaileddescription.para: It's an error to call this function on a timeout that was not previously added. Connection lock should be held when calling this.

briefdescription.para: Removes a pending call from the connection, such that the pending reply will be ignored.

detaileddescription.para: May drop the last reference to the pending call.

briefdescription.para: Acquire the transporter I/O path.

detaileddescription.para: This must be done before doing any I/O in the transporter. May sleep and drop the IO path mutex while waiting for the I/O path.

parameterdescription.para: maximum blocking time, or -1 for no limit.

simplesect.para: TRUE if the I/O path was acquired.

briefdescription.para: Release the I/O path when you're done with it.

detaileddescription.para: Only call after you've acquired the I/O. Wakes up at most one thread currently waiting to acquire the I/O path.

memberdef.argsstring: (DBusConnection *connection, DBusPendingCall *pending, unsigned int flags, int timeout_milliseconds)
memberdef.name: _dbus_connection_do_iteration_unlocked

briefdescription.para: Queues incoming messages and sends outgoing messages for this connection, optionally blocking in the process.

detaileddescription.para: Each call to _dbus_connection_do_iteration_unlocked() will call select() or poll() one time and then read or write data if possible.
The purpose of this function is to be able to flush outgoing messages or queue up incoming messages without returning control to the application and causing reentrancy weirdness.
The flags parameter allows you to specify whether to read incoming messages, write outgoing messages, or both, and whether to block if no immediate action is possible.
The timeout_milliseconds parameter does nothing unless the iteration is blocking.

If there are no outgoing messages and DBUS_ITERATION_DO_READING wasn't specified, then it's impossible to block, even if you specify DBUS_ITERATION_BLOCK; in that case the function returns immediately.

If pending is not NULL then a check is made if the pending call is completed after the io path has been required. If the call has been completed nothing is done. This must be done since the _dbus_connection_acquire_io_path releases the connection lock for a while.
Called with connection lock held.

parameterdescription.para: the pending call that should be checked or NULL
maximum blocking time, or -1 for no limit.

briefdescription.para: Creates a new connection for the given transport.

detaileddescription.para: A transport represents a message stream that uses some concrete mechanism, such as UNIX domain sockets. May return NULL if insufficient memory exists to create the connection.

simplesect.para: the new connection, or NULL on failure.

briefdescription.para: Increments the reference count of a DBusConnection.

detaileddescription.para: Requires that the caller already holds the connection lock.

briefdescription.para: Decrements the reference count of a DBusConnection.

detaileddescription.para: Requires that the caller already holds the connection lock.

briefdescription.para: A callback for use with dbus_watch_new() to create a DBusWatch.

xrefdescription.para: This is basically a hack - we could delete _dbus_transport_handle_watch() and the virtual handle_watch in DBusTransport if we got rid of it. The reason this is some work is threading, see the _dbus_connection_handle_watch() implementation.

parameterdescription.para: the current condition of the file descriptors being watched.
must be a pointer to a DBusConnection

simplesect.para: FALSE if the IO condition may not have been fully handled due to lack of memory

briefdescription.para: Closes a shared OR private connection, while dbus_connection_close() can only be used on private connections.

detaileddescription.para: Should only be called by the dbus code that owns the connection - an owner must be known, the open/close state is like malloc/free, not like ref/unref.

briefdescription.para: Like dbus_connection_send(), but assumes the connection is already locked on function entry, and unlocks before returning.

parameterdescription.para: return location for client serial of sent message

briefdescription.para: Used internally to handle the semantics of dbus_server_set_new_connection_function().

detaileddescription.para: If the new connection function does not ref the connection, we want to close it.
A bit of a hack, probably the new connection function should have returned a value for whether to close, or should have had to close the connection itself if it didn't want it.
But, this works OK as long as the new connection function doesn't do anything crazy like keep the connection around without ref'ing it.

We have to lock the connection across refcount check and close in case the new connection function spawns a thread that closes and unrefs. In that case, if the app thread closes and unrefs first, we'll harmlessly close again; if the app thread still has the ref, we'll close and then the app will close harmlessly. If the app unrefs without closing, the app is broken since if the app refs from the new connection function it is supposed to also close.
If we didn't atomically check the refcount and close with the lock held though, we could screw this up.

briefdescription.para: When a function that blocks has been called with a timeout, and we run out of memory, the time to wait for memory is based on the timeout.

detaileddescription.para: If the caller was willing to block a long time we wait a relatively long time for memory, if they were only willing to block briefly then we retry for memory at a rapid rate.
the timeout requested for blocking

briefdescription.para: Blocks until a pending call times out or gets a reply.

detaileddescription.para: Does not re-enter the main loop or run filter/path-registered callbacks. The reply to the message will not be seen by filter callbacks.
Returns immediately if pending call already got a reply.

xrefdescription.para: could use performance improvements (it keeps scanning the whole message queue for example)

parameterdescription.para: the pending call we block for a reply on

briefdescription.para: Implementation details of DBusConnection.
